siteProductLine.name: Elegant PT311
siteProductLine.overview:
The Elegant PT311 from Petlas is a summer tire that's designed for use on performance oriented coupes and sedans. Offering drivers solid traction and ride comfort, the Elegant PT311's tread pattern boosts handling performance.

Features & Benefits
  • Designed for use on coupes and sedans in warmer weather conditions
  • Tread pattern allows for solid traction in wet and dry conditions
  • Optimized design creates a quiet, comfortable ride and enhances durability for a long tread life
  • Engineered to give drivers sporty performance and handling
  • Stiff shoulder blocks enhance cornering performance at higher speeds while also fending off irregular wear for a longer tread life

siteProductSpecs.name: Category
siteProductSpecs.description: Summer tires are designed for use in warmer weather or in areas where the temperatures does not drop below 40 degrees. These tires are ideal for ue in warm, dry, and wet conditions that are common in the summertime.

siteProductSpecs.name: Vehicle
siteProductSpecs.description: Passenger tires are some of the most common tires you'll find on the roads today, and frequently used on coupes, sedans, hatchbacks, minivans, and other passenger vehicles. Passenger tires are available in a wide variety of types, such as all-season, winter, and ultra-high-performance.

siteProductSpecs.name: Mileage Warranty
siteProductSpecs.description: This product is not covered by a manufacturer’s treadlife warranty.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Index
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum carrying capacity for a tire determined by the manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Max Speed
siteProductSpecs.description: Maximum speed capability to safely carry a load for an extended period of time.

siteProductSpecs.name: Load Range
siteProductSpecs.description: The maximum load carrying strength at the specified inflation pressure, also known as ply rating.

siteProductSpecs.name: Sidewall
siteProductSpecs.description: The side of the tire between the tread and rim, with cosmetic branding as well as information about the tire including manufacturer, model, size, etc.

siteProductSpecs.name: UTQG
siteProductSpecs.description: Standards that measure treadwear, temperature resistance and traction, example: "640 A A".  The 640 is the treadwear test and it lasted 6.4 times longer than the comparison tire tested against.  The first "A" is the traction rating using straight-line wet traction on test surfaces (see information tables tab) and the second "A" is the temperature rating by testing operation at high speeds without heat-related failure (see information tables tab).

siteProductSpecs.name: Wet Traction
siteProductSpecs.description: Wet Traction is a piece of the UTQG for example if  UTQG is: 500 AA A, the wet traction piece is the second piece, the "AA".

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Depth
siteProductSpecs.description: Measured in 32nds of an inch, this metric shows how much tread life is left on a tire, with the tire's traction & stopping capabilities greatly diminished at 4/32nds and less. Tire manufacturers include "tire wear bars" at 2/32nds to indicate when your tire is worn out.

siteProductSpecs.name: Inflation Pressure
siteProductSpecs.description: The highest inflation pressure (measured in pounds of force per square inch, PSI) the tire is designed to contain, and should only be used when called for by the vehicle placard.

siteProductSpecs.name: Part Number
siteProductSpecs.description: An identifier of a particular tire line and size combination assigned by the tire manufacturer.

siteProductSpecs.name: Tread Design
siteProductSpecs.description: Tread design (or tread pattern) can affect handling, traction & noise for different driving styles & road conditions.

image.altText: Driving a Convertible in the Summer Sun

header.title: Summer tires
header.body: # Summer tires As their name suggests, Summer tires are designed for use in warmer weather conditions as their rubber compounds are not designed to perform in below freezing temperatures. Summer tires are built to excel in dry and wet conditions so that drivers receive consistent traction and performance. Summer tires are made by several top tire manufacturers including Toyo, Pirelli, Falken, Continental, Yokohama, and Michelin. If you're looking for summer tires for sale then you've come to the right place, as SimpleTire has thousands of summer tires that meet various driving needs and budgets. [Summer tire reviews](https://simpletire.com/categories/summer-tires/reviews)

articleList.description: Find out what summer tires are, how they differ from all season tires, and if you need them for your vehicle.
